data.title: Update CSON documentation link in snippets.cson
SHIFT-JIS saving issue
data.body:
### Description

(sorry for my poor english) If you try to save a file in SHIFT-JIS with non-SHIFT-JIS chars, it will save it...
In Notepad++ for exemple it replaces it.

Example : é => e but in Atom é is é even in SHIFT-JIS...
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a file in SHIFT-JIS
2. write some non-SHIFT-JIS chars (é à ç ù ñ ...)
3. Save it
4. The non-SHIFT-JIS chars are always here.

**Expected behavior:** Those chars have to be replaced by the SHIFT-JIS chars. é => e / ù => u / ñ => n / ...

**Actual behavior:** They stay like this but they are not SHIFT-JIS chars.

Thank you :)

I can't find an editor on Mac that can read/save/... SHIFT-JIS without any problem... I found Atom today and i like it. I wish you can improve it !

data.title: Menus open behind application window
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [Y] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [Y] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [Y] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [Y] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [Y] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [Y] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Atom menus (File, Edit etc) open behind the application window.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Fullscreen the window
2. Open a menu

**Expected behavior:** See the displayed menu

**Actual behavior:** Menu gets obscured by the application window
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

Atom    : 1.7.2
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
Distributor ID: Ubuntu
Description:    Ubuntu 16.04 LTS
Release:    16.04
Codename:   xenial

Both Ubuntu and Atom are fresh installs using the latest builds.
![virtualbox_ashlyns dev box_22_04_2016_21_50_45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9297796/14744145/0ad29196-08d8-11e6-8967-b6413af8ae55.png)

data.title: Atom Beta - Install Shell Commands doesn't work (or does it...)
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Using the menu option "Install Shell Commands" in the Atom Beta reports `The shell commands 'atom' and 'apm' are installed.` But they are sneaky commands - `atom` and `apm` will not do anything from a terminal... Because they are called `atom-beta` and `apm-beta`. Secrets and lies!
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Install Atom Beta (I'm on OSX, with no Atom non-Beta installed).
2. Open Atom Beta, click the menu option `Atom > Install Shell Commands`.
3. Atom displays an alert stating "Commands installed. The shell commands 'atom' and 'apm' are installed."
4. Open a fresh terminal and type `atom` or `apm`. The command is not found.

**Expected behavior:** I expect the commands displayed in the alert to work verbatim. My preference would be for the alert window text to read `atom-beta` and `apm-beta`.

**Actual behavior:** The commands need to be suffixed with `-beta`, or they will not work and you probably won't know why...
### Versions

OSX 10.11.4

```
$ atom-beta --version
Atom    : 1.8.0-beta2
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

$ apm-beta --version
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.11
git 2.7.2
```

data.title: `core:copy-selection` doesn't copy.
data.body:
### Description

As referenced in #11542, this keyman.cson should copy only when text is selected.

```
'atom-text-editor':
  'ctrl-c': 'core:copy-selection'    # linux and windows
```
### Steps to Reproduce
1. change cson
2. select new text
3. ctrl-c
4. Change cursor insertion point
5. Ctrl-v

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

New text was copied to clipboard.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

Old text pasted.  New text was never copied to clipboard.
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

1.5.3

data.title: Support block highlighting
data.body:
### Description

On Mac you can hold Option and click and drag over a block of text to highlight in a rectangle area. You can get a sample of how this should work if you look at the TextEdit.app on OS X. Hold option, click and drag over multiline text. It would be nice if Atom did the same.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open text file with multiline text.
2. Hold Option and click and drag over text.

**Expected behavior:**
The highlighted text should be a rectangle from where you started to where you ended the drag.

**Actual behavior:** 
The highligted text includes the rest of the lines between where you started and where you ended the drag.
### Versions

Atom 1.7.2 on OS X 10.11.4

data.title: Eclipse like perspective
data.body:
i am missing an important feature that i used to enjoy in Eclipse: the perspectives.

Right now, a lot of plugins are being activated for no reason. It is not easy to disable some plugins in certain projects.

This would be solved by having perspective feature. Plugins can be activated and deactivated when perspectives are changed.

data.title: Decompose ligatures when the cursor is in/beside them
data.body:
### Description

I use FiraCode2 with ligature support in Atom, and for the most part it's very nice.

However, I find it very difficult to edit ligatures. For example, I often need to change <$> to <*> in Haskell, but Atom does not show where in the ligature the cursor is, and I often lose time erasing the wrong part of the ligature.
Similarly, I will often try to delete the space before an arrow -> , but I end up deleting the first dash - because the cursor is shown beside the ligature, even when its actual position is in the middle.

Ideally, when the cursor was at the edge of, or inside a ligature, it would be rendered not as the single character, but as the actual simple characters which make it up.

Is this possible? If it is not, consider this a request that it be added, or at least supported in a package.

Thanks!
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Set the font to FiraCode, HaskLig, or another ligature-supporting font
2. Enter a ligature, such as `->`
3. Move the cursor from one side to the ligature of the other

**Expected behavior:** The ligature is decomposed into its constituent characters, or the cursor is shown inside the ligature.

**Actual behavior:** The cursor remains to the right of the ligature.
### Versions

I've tested in 1.7.1, but it showed up in all previous versions I'd used.

data.title: Project Folders are removed when window is closed
data.body:
### Description

When you close every window without quitting the program, all the project folders are removed the next time you open a window.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Close all windows `Cmd + Shift + W`
2. Open Atom

**Expected behavior:** Project folders in the same state I left them.

**Actual behavior:** All project folders have been removed.
### Versions

```
Atom    : 1.7.2
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.8.0

OSX 10.10.5
```

data.title: Reverting ctrl-tab to `pane:show-next-item` won't tab in order if tabs are rearranged via drag-and-drop or when using `Add New Tabs At End`
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

After updating to Atom 1.7.2 and reverting the `ctrl-tab` and `ctrl-shift-tab` behavior via the config in the release blog post:

```
'body':
  'ctrl-tab ^ctrl': 'unset!'
  'ctrl-tab': 'pane:show-next-item'
  'ctrl-shift-tab ^ctrl': 'unset!'
  'ctrl-shift-tab': 'pane:show-previous-item'
```

`ctrl-tab` and `ctrl-shift-tab` no longer tab through panes in order if they have been rearranged via drag-and-drop or if you are using the `Add New Tabs At End` config option from the `tabs` core package and open a file with an active tab somewhere in the middle of the list.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Copy the config block from the MRU Tab Change blog post into your `keymap.cson` file.
2. Open 3-5 files from the tree / fuzzy open / however. Verify that you can `ctrl-tab` through them in order.
3. Drag-and-drop to rearrange them, or enable `Add New Tabs At End` in the `tabs` core package and select a tab other than the last, then open a file via the tree or the fuzzy finder.
4. Attempt to `ctrl-tab` and see that the order for selection is wrong.

**Expected behavior:** You can `ctrl-tab` through your open files in order as you could in Atom < 1.7.x releases.

**Actual behavior:** `ctrl-tab` does not progress through visual tab order and instead appears to follow the order of when the files were opened.
### Versions

```
$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.7.2
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
```

data.title: Use ohnogit
data.body:
We’ve pulled the brains of `GitRepositoryAsync` out into its own package: https://github.com/github/ohnogit

This lets others use it for projects other than Atom.

data.title: Cutting a few thousand selections: Uncaught RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded
data.body:
This also occurs in safe mode.
Every attempt to reproduce succeeds for me.
I've search for previously reported issues but found none that match my situation.
After the error report appears I can continue to use Atom as usual with no harm done apparently.

To reproduce:
1. Open a text file with 13000 lines, with lines alternating between 18 printables and one tab character
2. Ctrl+F
3. Do RegExp search for ^[^\s]+.*$
4. Press Alt+Enter to select every line that is not a line with just a tab character
5. Ctrl+X
6. Wait.
7. "Editor is not responding" => "Keep Waiting"
8. Wait.
9. The error occurrs

**Atom Version**: 1.7.2
**System**: Ubuntu 15.10
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded

```
At /usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/text-buffer/node_modules/atom-patch/dist/patch.js:250

RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded
    at Patch.changesForSubtree (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/text-buffer/node_modules/atom-patch/dist/patch.js:250:38)
    at Patch.changesForSubtree (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/text-buffer/node_modules/atom-patch/dist/patch.js:256:12)
(the above line repeats 5920 times)
    at Patch.replaceChangedText (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/text-buffer/node_modules/atom-patch/dist/patch.js:231:31)
    at Patch.splice (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/text-buffer/node_modules/atom-patch/dist/patch.js:201:59)
    at Function.compose (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/text-buffer/node_modules/atom-patch/dist/patch.js:52:27)
    at /usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/text-buffer.js:1370:64
```
### Commands

```
     -2:02.1.0 core:move-right (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
  3x -2:01.7.0 core:move-left (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -2:00.5.0 core:move-right (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -1:59.8.0 core:select-all (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
  5x -1:54.3.0 core:backspace (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
     -1:52.8.0 editor:consolidate-selections (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
     -1:52.8.0 core:cancel (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
     -1:50.1.0 find-and-replace:show (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -1:33.3.0 find-and-replace:find-all (atom-text-editor.editor.mini.is-focused)
     -1:29.4.0 core:cut (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:29.2.0 core:select-all (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:27.2.0 core:paste (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:27 editor:consolidate-selections (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:27 core:cancel (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:27 editor:consolidate-selections (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:27 core:cancel (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
```
### Config

``` json
{
  "core": {},
  "editor": {
    "scrollPastEnd": true,
    "showIndentGuide": true,
    "showInvisibles": true
  }
}
```
### Installed Packages

``` coffee
# User
package-sync-plus, v0.1.2

# Dev
No dev packages
```

data.title: Atom crashes on startup
data.body:
### Description

Atom crashes on startup. 
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open Atom
2. Wait a few seconds

**Expected behavior:** 
Atom opens without error

**Actual behavior:**
Atom crashes and tels me so:

![screenshot from 2016-04-21 13-30-41](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3709210/14708025/559c1f00-07c8-11e6-968d-ef80fa213189.png)
### Versions

apm:                1.9.2
npm:                2.13.3
node:               0.10.40
python:            3.5.1
git:                  2.8.0

Atom    : 1.9.0-dev-f00ac5c
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

OS: Arch Linux
DE: Gnome 3.20
Kernel: 4.5.1-1-ARCH

I first noticed this running Atom 1.6.2-1. I upgraded to see if that worked, it didn't.
### What I have tried
- Running Atom in safe mode
- Disabling all community extensions
- Removing all community extensions 
- Disabling all extensions
- Removing atom and its configuration files and building atom from git.
### Crashlog

App load time: 602ms
Failed to get crash dump id.
Report Id:

data.title: Can not delete folder
data.body:
### Description

Can not delete or move the folder, if the folder have sub-folder and the sub-folder is unfolded.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Create the folder A;
2. Create the folder B under A;
3. Unfold the folder B in the Tree View;
4. Delete A;

**Expected behavior:** Delete the folder A and B;

**Actual behavior:** Get error;
### Versions

Atom    : 1.7.2
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python
git 2.7.4.windows.1
visual studio

OS: Windows 7 SP 1

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

data.title: strange behavior by opening New File with TreeView
data.body:
### Description

hi, 
supposed i will work on a existing file style.css (actual with no changes) and i press `STRG + N`, the new window replace my "style.css" tab-window. 
if i change something, and press STRG + N`, the new file appear on a new tab-window.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. [start atom in some project folder]
2. [open a file within Tree View (don't edit these file]
3. [press 'STRG + N']

**Expected behavior:**
But imho, a new file should open a new tab-window.

**Actual behavior:** 
 the new window replace my "style.css" tab-window. 
### Versions

Atom 1.7.2
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.6
git 1.9.1

data.title: The feature about "find in project" is so weakly!
data.body: Compared to Notepad++, the feature about "find in project" is so weakly! Can anyone support a package about this feature?

data.title: Opening Atom triggers a screenshot (Gnome)
data.body:
Hello,

I've had this problem since ever, but I never opened an issue because this is a somewhat obscure problem; if anyone has answers, awesome. If not, it's really a minor disagreement.

Upon launching Atom, the electron window starts, and triggers a desktop screenshot before loading any more of the UI.

This happens on Gnome desktop, no matter how Atom was launched: command-line, icon-click, keybinding shortcut, shell switcher.

Not including version, because this has been happening since pre 1.0 until now (1.8).

data.title: Content Security Policy fixes
data.body:
Add blob: protocol to img-src and media-src sources. Add data: and mediastream: protocols to media-src.

These changes are needed to fix video chat in the Floobits Atom plugin (issue https://github.com/Floobits/floobits-atom/issues/114). A CSP directive of `default-src: *` doesn't cover protocols like `blob:`, `data:`, or `mediastream:`, which the Floobits package uses.

data.title: "Keep Waiting" dialog blocks until closed
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

The "keep waiting" dialog that appears when Atom becomes unresponsive blocks until it is closed, preventing Atom from ever becoming responsive again until "keep waiting" is selected.  This is because Atom is performing a synchronous call to `dialog.showMessageBox` instead of an async one.  In addition, there is no code in place to automatically close the dialog if/when Atom does regain responsiveness.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Get Atom into an unresponsive state and have the "keep waiting" dialog appear
2. Wait for Atom to become responsive again
3. :zzz:

**Expected behavior:** Atom to regain responsiveness

**Actual behavior:** Atom hangs forever until an option is selected
### Versions

```
Atom    : 1.9.0-dev-8ece1ee
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
```

```
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.7.0.windows.1
visual studio 2015
```

Windows 10 x64.

data.title: build: [ci skip] add lint npm script
data.body: Aim: to be able to invoke only linting from command line, as opposed to the whole (long) build process. With this, one can call `npm run lint` from project root directory.

data.title: the editor crashes shortly after startup
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

When opening atom, the editor freezes and then crashes within the first minute.  
This issue was not occurring on atom v. `1.6.2`. I confirmed this on my machine by downgrading the package to said version, the issue didn't reoccur.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Start atom. Whether you're using `--safe` or not does not matter.
2. The editor will now crash. See the screenshot below for more details.

**Expected behavior:**

The editor should function normally

**Actual behavior:**

The editor crashes
![screenshot from 2016-04-20 23-25-42](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8442384/14691040/653caa7a-074f-11e6-9a9a-2d1b622d1bb4.png)
### Versions

I have tested the following versions of atom on `Arch Linux x86_64`, all of which seem to have the same issue: 
- atom 1.7.1  
- atom 1.9.0-dev-9ff5fb2 (built from source)  
### Additional information

`~/.atom/nohup.out` contains `Failed to get crash dump id.`
### Related Issues

https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/11519#issuecomment-212033766  
https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/11519#issuecomment-212456837

data.title: The editor has crashed
data.body: ### Description Seeming random crashs preceded by the dropdown image below. Occur frequently, once a day or so. Often on first use in a while (morning etc) ### Steps to Reproduce 1. [First Step] 2. [Second Step] 3. [and so on...] **Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen] **Actual behavior:** [What actually happened] ### Versions Crash details here: backspaces/Atom Helper_2016-04-20-100803_MBP13.crash OSX 10.11.4 Has occurred on both MBP & iMac, both bought within the year. MBP13|~/Library/Logs/DiagnosticReports[569] : atom --version Atom : 1.7.1 Electron: 0.36.8 Chrome : 47.0.2526.110 Node : 5.1.1 MBP13|~/Library/Logs/DiagnosticReports[570] : apm --version apm 1.9.2 npm 2.13.3 node 0.10.40 python 2.7.10 git 2.4.5
